description: Li Ming is a renowned Chinese chef who specializes in Sichuan cuisine. He has over 20 years of experience in the culinary industry and has won numerous awards for his dishes.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.method: 1. Cut the chicken into small pieces and marinate in soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch for 30 minutes. 2. Stir-fry the chicken in a wok with oil until cooked through. 3. Add the peanuts, dried chili peppers, Sichuan peppercorns, and garlic and stir-fry for another minute. 4. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
recipes.method: 1. Brown the ground pork in a wok with oil. 2. Add the doubanjiang and Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 3. Add the tofu and some water, then simmer for 5 minutes. 4. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Dan Dan Noodles
recipes.method: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions. 2. Brown the ground pork in a wok with oil. 3. Add the doubanjiang and Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 4. Toss the noodles with the pork sauce and garnish with chopped green onions.

description: Chen Wei is a master of Cantonese cuisine and is known for his innovative twists on traditional dishes. He has been cooking for over 30 years and has trained many successful chefs.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
recipes.method: 1. Clean and scale the fish, then place on a plate. 2. Sprinkle with sliced ginger and scallions. 3. Steam the fish for 10-15 minutes, depending on the size. 4. Drizzle with soy sauce and Shaoxing wine before serving.

recipes.name: Stir-fried Clams with Black Bean Sauce
recipes.method: 1. Soak the clams in water for at least 30 minutes to remove sand. 2. Stir-fry the garlic and ginger in a wok with oil until fragrant. 3. Add the clams and black bean sauce and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until the clams open. 4. Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

recipes.name: Dan Dan Noodles
recipes.method: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions. 2. Brown the ground pork in a wok with oil. 3. Add the doubanjiang and Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 4. Toss the noodles with the pork sauce and garnish with chopped green onions.
